markdownRemark.html:
Plan

Okay, so if I wanted to lay out a plan for the next… 4 - 6 months, I think I should do a few different things:

  1. Pick an end date. Stick to it as a goal.
  2. Produce a list of things I want to implement. Edit it down.
  3. Try to map out roughly how much time that’d give me per thing. Edit things down further.
  4. Get feedback on this plan throughout. Feedback on the items in list, the number of items, and the amount of time, if possible.

The existing work is at https://github.com/BruOp/bdr11, which I really need to write a new README for.

Things to do

Already Done

Re-implementation, but already finished. Used to “dog food” the rendering lib so far.

  • Skinning
  • Normal Mapping
  • GLTF Loading
  • Simple PBR

Re-implementation

These are items I’ve already implemented as standalone examples in BGFX, but would like to implement as part of my new lib/example.

  • Tone Mapping
  • Forward lighting
  • PBR IBL
  • (Better) Normal Map Filtering
  • Cascaded Shadow Maps

New Work

  • Motion Blur
  • Depth of Field
  • TAA
  • Clustered Forward Rendering
  • Volumetrics
  • Sky rendering
  • GPU particle system

  • Engine work:

    • D3D11 Backend (in progress)
    • Better support for Material variations, to make it easier to extend systems for features like alpha blending, skinning, etc.
    • Better support for “RenderingSystems” that enable composition of techniques, including post processing and compute passes
    • Multi-threading. At first, just putting the render loop on it’s own thread, eventually maybe having additional tasks for sorting drawables, etc.

My biggest current issue is figuring how to organize and manage the different render systems and material variations.

Schedule

  • If I have 6 Months to finish this, that puts me in August. 4 months is June/early-July
  • I also need to write blogs posts for these features, and for my architecture in general. Not a lot of time, but I think it’s definitely do-able given how much I was able to do in 6 months on a part time basis.

With five items to re-implement, and seven to implement from scratch, at 6 months I have about 0.5 months for each item. Including any blog posts I write (which I’m very out of practise with).
